articles.description: Follow live text and radio coverage of Wednesday's Champions League action, with Arsenal and Manchester United both playing.
articles.title: Champions League build-up: Man Utd & Arsenal both in action

articles.description: Ben Stokes hits a superb century as England boost their beleaguered World Cup campaign with a 160-run victory over the Netherlands in Pune.
articles.title: Stokes' fine century helps England beat Netherlands

articles.description: England are a "sinking ship" and players need to "take responsibility" for a poor World Cup, says former captain Eoin Morgan.
articles.title: England are a 'sinking ship' - ex-captain Morgan

articles.description: Watch as England's Joe Root is bowled through his legs by Netherland's Logan van Beek for 28 in their Cricket World Cup match in Pune.
articles.title: 'He's been nutmegged!' - Root bowled through his legs by Van Beek

articles.description: Netherlands' Aryan Dutt bowls "the worst ball of the World Cup" to England's Ben Stokes who hits it for six during their Cricket World Cup match in Pune.
articles.title: 'Worst ball of the World Cup' - Stokes smashes Dutt for six

articles.description: Ballymena United manager Jim Ervin and Coleraine counterpart Oran Kearney had contrasting fortunes of agony and ecstasy in a marathon penalty shootout at the Warden Street Showgrounds on Tuesday.
articles.title: 'A strange, crazy night' - 44-penalty cup shootout

articles.description: Oleksandr Usyk hopes his undisputed heavyweight world title fight with Tyson Fury will take place in February in Saudi Arabia.
articles.title: Usyk hopes Fury fight will happen in February

articles.description: New Portland Timbers head coach Phil Neville wants to meet fans after he faced criticism for past controversial tweets about women.
articles.title: Neville wants to meet Portland fans after outcry

articles.description: Paris 2024 organisers say they are committed to hosting the Olympic surfing event at its planned site in Tahiti - despite concerns about the environmental impact.
articles.title: Olympic surf plan 'unchanged' despite eco fears

articles.description: World Cup final referee Wayne Barnes reveals "vile" social media abuse towards him and his family "crossed a line" and he says those responsible should be punished.
articles.title: Social media abuse crossed line - World Cup final referee
